page.title: 01The Area
page.content: This area is primarily rural. It lies on the outskirts of a small town,{Irvinestown.}The majority of the people in this area are involved in farming, or travel to work in Irvinestown or the two main urban centres near us, Enniskillen and Omagh. The landscape is typical of a lot of Fermanagh, hills and dales. The hills are mostly drumlins left after the retreat of the ice-age. The area receives a lot of rainfall and so drainage is of great importance to farmers. At the moment many farmers are engaged in major reclamation and drainage schemes. The E.E.C. and the Dept. of Agriculture are offering good grants for this work. The area is pleasant to live in, people are friendly and most facilities are available.
